required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Gas Exchange Derangement Physiopathology in Critically Ill Patients With COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Gas Exchange Derangement Physiopathology and Response to Different Levels of Positive End-expiratory Pressure in Critically Ill Patients With COVID-19

brief_summary.textblock: The study was designed to understand the pathophysiology of gas exchange derangement in critically ill patients with COVID-19. Specifically we will evaluate the effect of 3 different levels of positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP) and two different levels of inspiratory oxygen fraction (FiO2) on gas exchange by analyzing shunt and dead space. Furthermore, complete respiratory mechanics and distribution of ventilation and perfusion by electrical impedance tomography will be assessed at each level of PEEP.

primary_outcome.measure: Shunt at three different levels of positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes after change of positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP) level
primary_outcome.description: Shunt measured by arterial and mixed venous blood samples at each level of PEEP

secondary_outcome.measure: Dead space at three different levels of positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes after change of positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP) level
secondary_outcome.description: Dead space measured by capnography at each level of PEEP

secondary_outcome.measure: Shunt and dead space at two different levels of inspiratory oxygen fraction for each level of positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes after change of positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP) level
secondary_outcome.description: Shunt measured by arterial and mixed venous blood samples and dead space measured by capnography at each level of PEEP

secondary_outcome.measure: Ventilation/perfusion at three different levels of positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP) assessed by electrical impedance tomography (EIT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes after change of positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP) level
secondary_outcome.description: Ventilation/perfusion assessed by Electrical Impedance Tomography at each level of PEEP

secondary_outcome.measure: Respiratory mechanics at three different levels of positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes after change of positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP) level
secondary_outcome.description: Respiratory mechanics (including esophageal pressure measurement) assessed at each level of PEEP by performing end-inspiratory and end-expiratory pauses

arm_group.description: Test of three different levels of positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP)

intervention.description: Three different levels of PEEP and two different levels of FiO2 will be tested without changing anything else in the baseline patient ventilation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients admitted in intensive care unit for COVID-19 related Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS) requiring invasive mechanical ventilation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Hemodynamic instability (80-90 mmHg increase or 30-40 mmHg decrease systolic arterial pressure compared to baseline value or need of vasopressors to maintain systolic blood pressure higher than 85 mmHg or electrocardiogram evidence of ischemia/arrhythmias)
- Presence of pneumothorax and/or pneumomediastinum
- Contraindications to Electrical Impedance Tomography (pacemaker, implantable cardioverter defibrillator, thoracic drainages)

overall_official.affiliation: Fondazione IRCCS Ca' Granda, Ospedale Maggiore Policlinico
